intro: Geissorhiza brevituba, commonly known as the dwarf pipe-root, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and a short, tuberous root system. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of exotic plants.
